snippet: Those at greatest risk of wandering off were autistic children with severe intellectual deficits and those who do not respond to their names.
abstract: Study published in journal Pediatrics suggests that tendency for autistic children to wander off is alarmingly common and has led to numerous deaths by drowning and in traffic accidents.
lead_paragraph: Those at greatest risk of wandering off were autistic children with severe intellectual deficits and those who do not respond to their names.

headline.seo: Study Shows Autistic Children Are Likely to Wander
headline.main: Study Shows Children With Autism Tend to Stray
headline.print_headline: Study Shows Children With Autism Tend to Stray
